text: {"answer":"E","reasoning":"i is incorrect because the classic Roman rule already addresses treasure found on another’s land (allocation to finder/landowner), so it is not a clear case requiring departure. iii is incorrect because the Digest/Pandects profoundly shaped Western legal science and civil-law tradition, not marginally. iv is incorrect because in Luhmann the political system’s code is typically government/opposition (or power/no power), while “power” is the medium; phrasing it as “power”/“not power” as the code is not accurate in standard presentations."}
